meanings.definition: The act of depriving something of its vitality or life force.
meanings.sent1: The devitalization of the plant was caused by lack of sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The devitalization of the community was evident in the abandoned buildings.
meanings.sent3: The devitalization of the party was when the music suddenly stopped.
meanings.sent4: The devitalization of the economy left many people struggling to find work.
meanings.sent5: The devitalization of the forest after the wildfire was heartbreaking to witness.

meanings.definition: The state of being deprived of vitality or life force.
meanings.sent1: The patient's devitalization was concerning to the doctors.
meanings.sent2: The devitalization of the lake was evident in the lack of fish.
meanings.sent3: The devitalization of the soccer team was turned around with a new coach.
meanings.sent4: The devitalization of the old building made it seem haunted.
meanings.sent5: The devitalization of the flower was reversed with proper care and sunlight.
